author: Jamie Bullen
title: Judge cleared of wrongdoing after she called racist thug 'a bit of a c***'
text:
Monday 9 January 2017 22:39 BST Cleared: Patricia Lynch will not face misconduct proceedings following her exchange with John Hennigan 
A judge who called a racist thug “a bit of a c***” after he hurled a foul-mouthed tirade at her has been cleared of misconduct. 
Patricia Lynch QC was sentencing John Hennigan at Chelmsford Crown Court for his ninth breach of an anti-social behaviour order in 11 years when the exchange took place. 
Hennigan was in the dock on August 10 when he disagreed with Judge Lynch and told her: “It's obvious, isn't it? Because you're a c*** and I'm not." 
To which she responded: “Well, you are a bit of a c*** yourself. Being offensive to me does not make things better at all." 
Shouting back, he said: "Go f*** yourself", to which the QC replied: "You too. Take him down." 
Hennigan was jailed for 18 months for insulting and making racist slurs to a black Caribbean mother in Harlow. 
The judge’s use of language drew complaints to the Judicial Conducts Investigations Office (JCIO)but the body confirmed on Monday that no action will be taken. Man has sentence increased after calling judge a b**** in court 
An investigation report sent by the JCIO to one of the complainants states: "Although the Lord Chancellor and Lord Chief Justice considered HHJ Lynch's remarks to be inappropriate, they did not find that they amounted to misconduct or warranted disciplinary action." 
"With the agreement of the Lord Chancellor, the Lord Chief Justice therefore advised HHJ Lynch to ensure that she responded appropriately in court at all times." 
Judge Lynch has since "apologised unreservedly for her remarks". 
She also told investigators she "deeply regretted the incident" and said her "remarks were a momentary lapse of judgment which should have never happened". More about:
